alert.note: Alert for Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 6:34PM CDT until May 07 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho, Runnels and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from Veribest to Ballinger, moving northeast at 20 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from Veribest and Mereta to Paint Rock. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ballinger, Paint Rock, Rowena, Lowake, Mereta, Veribest, Us-83 Near The Concho-Runnels County Line, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1929, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 380 And Ranch Road 381 and The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1929 And Ranch Road 2134. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
